title: #ICYMI: Baseball: The Perfect Game
description:
There have only been 23 perfect games in baseball’s 140-year history – and only one in the World Series, by Don Larsen in 1956. Chuck Nice and Gary O’Reilly explore what it takes to throw a perfect game, with guests Neil Tyson and Houston Astros announcer Geoff Blum.
Don’t miss an episode of Playing with Science. Subscribe to our channels on:
TuneIn: tunein.com/playingwithscience
Apple Podcasts: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/playing-with-science/id1198280360
GooglePlay Music: https://play.google.com/music/listen?u=0#/ps/Iimke5bwpoh2nb25swchmw6kzjq
SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/startalk_playing-with-science
Stitcher: http://www.stitcher.com/podcast/startalk/playing-with-science
NOTE: StarTalk All-Access subscribers can watch or listen to this entire episode commercial-free: https://www.startalkradio.net/all-access/baseball-the-perfect-game/
Photo Credit: AP file photo via San Diego Union Tribune at http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/sports/aztecs/sd-sp-larsen-1008-story.html
author: feed@startalkradio.net (Neil deGrasse Tyson)
